title: Toxic Team all reports me, will punishment happen just because I got ganged up on?
body: I was in a game playing kha'zix. I'm doing great, being very nice to everybody, when me and the enemy vayne decide to have some fun dancing (after all, it's blind pick, not ranked or something). My team comes in and kills the vayne, which upset me, but I didn't comment. Later, the Ezreal dies, and complains that the kha'zix was throwing, and that everyone should report him. I told him to chill, but he wouldn't, and the enemy team agreed with him. They all reported me and the vayne in the end, making me worried that I will receive an unfair punishment due to people being toxic. Is there any way I can tell Riot that it was not me being toxic or feeding?

replies.body: The number of reports does not matter. You will not be punished if your behavior was not bad, even if you're reported by all 9 other players in every game.
Riot looks at chat logs so as long as you weren't toxic you have no reason to worry.

> [{quoted}](name=D3m37r1,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=YOncWiIr,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-01-20T21:08:35.593+0000)
>
> Riot looks at chat logs so as long as you weren't toxic you have no reason to worry.

a bot looks at the chat logs*
Only if u responded with one toxic statement. Then those 4 players play another game while you get punished. Fair system.
dont retaliate and youll be fine
I didn't say a toxic word towards them. I did say wtf, when they killed the Vayne, but besides that, I was only telling them nicely to calm down. Thanks for the advice!
probably not so long as you didn't say a mean word :'(((((

As long as you weren't rude/toxic when you told him to chill, there shouldn't be any issue with it.  Now that Vayne on the other hand... she might need to watch out for being reported for inting because dayum that score... but no, looking at yours, there's no obvious feeding happening. 

This is one of my favorite quotes from Riot Tantram:
> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=unobngtr,comment-id=00000000000000010001000200000000000000000001,timestamp=2016-04-05T18:00:32.861+0000)
>
> Actually, Erdrik is correct here.
> 
> A report flags a game for review. They do not establish guilt. The game is then reviewed for harassment, feeding, etc. This is why 'troll reporting' or 'gang reporting' do not work. False or inaccurate reports are thrown out.
>
>_You can say absolutely nothing, and still be reported and punished for it._
> 
> You cannot ever be punished for saying nothing .. unless of course it's for something gameplay related like feeding, afking or cheating. But, you can never be punished for offensive language, hate speech or verbal abuse if you said nothing.

The italicized line is part of a comment from someone else that he was responding to.  You can find the entire thread [here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/unobngtr-how-player-behavior-penalties-affect-hextech-crafting) if you are interested in reading more on it.
I get reported by 10 players every game :(
